publicationStmt.p: This document contains the text of the Vilna edition of the Mishnah (beginning with m. B. Mes. Ch. 2), slightly normalized and all punctuation removed, as the basis for the alignment of the witnesses to the text of the Mishnah. The text below uses the unvocalized text at , corrected to reflect the text of Yakhin u-Boaz

listWit.witness: National Museum of Hungary, Kaufmann A50.
Cambridge Add. 470.1Based on Lowe edition; for Ch. 2, checked against photos of the original ref.
Bibliothèque nationale de France. MS Hébreu 328-329, 230b-231b
Bayerische Staatsbibliothek Handschrift Cod.Hebr.95 (1342)Munich Manuscript of the Babylonian Talmud
Leiden Scaliger Or. 4720, 1289 Manuscript of the Palestinian Talmud
Cairo Genizah TS E1.99 f. 1r - 2v (Cambridge)Bava Qamma 2:1 - 3:5; 10:9 - 10; Bava Metsi'a 1:1 - 2:5
Cairo Genizah TS NS 329.286 f. 1r - 1v (Cambridge)Bava Qamma 10:8 - 10; Bava Metsi'a 1:1 - 2:10

interpGrp.desc: The following describes the structure of the Mishnah, to be referenced by xml:id. The Mishnah is divided into six orders, each divided into tractates, each of which is further divided into chapters and mishnayot (mishnahs). Full references to an individual section uses the following system: ref.order.tractate.chapter.mishnah. Order and tractate refs are numerical and follow the outline below. By convention, references to chapter and mishnah are numerical. When looking up a specific witness, "ref." is replaced by the relevant /TEI/teiHeader/fileDesc/sourceDesc/listWit/witness@xml:id

tagsDecl.rendition: Text padding extends into lines below displacing text. Use CSS to render
Text is ornamented in some way

refsDecl.p:
The following describes the structure of the Mishnah, to be referenced by xml:id. The Mishnah is divided into six orders, each divided into tractates, each of which is further divided into chapters and mishnayot (mishnahs). Full references to an individual section uses the following system: ref.order.tractate.chapter.mishnah. Order and tractate refs are numerical and follow the outline below. By convention, references to chapter and mishnah are numerical. When looking up a specific witness, "ref." is replaced by the relevant /TEI/teiHeader/fileDesc/sourceDesc/listWit/witness@xml:id
